macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks Hit New Highs Despite Fed Chair Powell Investigation Threats
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose 0.2% to 6,977.3, Dow added 0.2% to 49,590.2, and Nasdaq gained 0.3% to 23,733.9, all reaching fresh highs amid reports of Justice Department threats against Fed Chair Jerome Powell; markets recovered focusing on rates and earnings.

items.title: Nasdaq Leads Gains as Markets Brush Off Criminal Probe into Federal Reserve
items.summary: US equities advanced with Nasdaq up 0.26% to 23,733, S&P 500 +0.16% to 6,977, and Dow +0.17% to 49,590 despite concerns over a criminal investigation into the Fed; Treasury yields edged higher with 10-year at 4.175%.

items.title: Walmart Surges 3% on Nasdaq 100 Inclusion and AI Features, Alphabet Rises on Apple Deal
items.summary: Walmart jumped 3.0% following Nasdaq 100 inclusion and new AI features, while Alphabet gained 1.0% after Apple agreed to use Gemini in Siri; Capital One dropped 6.4% and Citigroup fell 3.0% on Trump's proposed 10% credit-card rate cap.

items.title: Gold Hits Record High at $4,597 as Investors Seek Safe Havens Amid Fed Uncertainty
items.summary: Gold surged 1.95% to a record close of $4,597.51 amid market uncertainty from Fed probe; oil prices also rose with Brent up 1.41% to $64.23 and WTI +0.64% to $59.50 on Iranian export concerns.

items.title: VIX Firms at ~15 on CPI Risks, Europe and Asia Gain Modestly
items.summary: Volatility index VIX rose to around 15 amid CPI hedging; European stocks added small gains with Prosus +3.7%, while China-led Asia rallied as deflation fears eased; Heineken dropped 4.1% on CEO departure.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Trades Between $90K-$92K as Crypto Market Cap Hits $3.14T Up 1.48%
items.summary: Bitcoin fluctuated between $90,128 and $92,672 over the past 24 hours, closing at $92,550 up 1.92%, while the global crypto market cap rose 1.48% to $3.14T. Major coins like DOGE (+2.34%), SOL (+1.72%), and XRP (+1.28%) saw gains amid mixed trading.

items.title: Senator Warren Demands SEC Answers on Crypto in 401(k)s After Trump Executive Order
items.summary: Senator Elizabeth Warren wrote to SEC Chair Paul Atkins requesting details on protecting investors from crypto in retirement plans following President Trump’s August executive order easing inclusion of digital assets in 401(k)s. She highlighted risks of volatility and manipulation, demanding responses by January 27.

items.title: US Senate Agriculture Committee Delays Crypto Market Structure Bill Revision
items.summary: The U.S. Senate Agriculture Committee has delayed revisions to a crypto market structure bill amid ongoing market uncertainty and anticipation of the December CPI report.

items.title: US Senators Unveil Draft Legislation to Define Crypto Market Rules and Jurisdiction
items.summary: U.S. senators introduced long-awaited draft legislation creating a framework for cryptocurrency that clarifies regulatory jurisdiction over the sector.

items.title: 21Shares Launches Bitcoin and Gold ETP on London Stock Exchange
items.summary: 21Shares has launched a new Bitcoin and Gold Exchange Traded Product (ETP) on the London Stock Exchange, expanding access to combined crypto and precious metal investments.

items.title: The Crypto Company Outlines 2026 Revenue Focus After 2025 Growth in Crypto Treasury and Acquisitions
items.summary: The Crypto Company (CRCW) highlighted 2025 achievements including $2M funding, team expansion, digital asset treasury launch, and debt reduction, while prioritizing organic revenue growth and accretive acquisitions for 2026.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Freenome Expands AI and Deep Learning Initiatives with NVIDIA for Cancer Detection
items.summary: Freenome announced a collaboration with NVIDIA to optimize its fragment-level deep learning (FLDL) model for analyzing large cfDNA datasets from blood tests, improving speed and accuracy in multi-cancer detection.

items.title: Materials Project Advances AI Revolution in Materials Science
items.summary: The Materials Project is enabling machine learning for materials discovery with its vast curated datasets, supporting AI models from startups and companies, and integrating with Berkeley Lab’s autonomous A-Lab for real-world synthesis.

items.title: Dartmouth Announces AI Partnership with Anthropic and AWS Amid Controversy
items.summary: Dartmouth College launched an institutional AI partnership with Anthropic and AWS, gaining access to Bedrock for AI software development, despite faculty lawsuits accusing Anthropic of plagiarizing publications for training Claude.

items.title: Integrated Quantum Technologies Files Patent for Post-Quantum AI Infrastructure
items.summary: Integrated Quantum Technologies filed a provisional U.S. patent for its privacy-preserving AIQu platform, including AIQu VEIL, designed to secure AI and machine learning against quantum threats and scale enterprise deployments.

items.title: Meta Launches 'Meta Compute' AI Infrastructure Initiative
items.summary: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced Meta Compute, a decade-long plan to build tens of gigawatts of AI infrastructure, backed by massive investments in data centers and partnerships to pursue superintelligence.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Ubisoft Proposes Layoffs at Massive Entertainment and Ubisoft Stockholm
items.summary: Ubisoft plans to lay off 55 employees at its Swedish studios Massive Entertainment and Ubisoft Stockholm, continuing a wave of layoffs following a $1.25 billion investment from Tencent.

items.title: Ubisoft to Reconsider Compensation for Laid-Off Halifax Workers
items.summary: Ubisoft has agreed to review and potentially increase compensation packages for 71 workers laid off after the closure of its Halifax studio.

items.title: Coach Partners with The Sims 4 for Free Virtual Fashion Content
items.summary: Coach is expanding into gaming with free virtual fashion items in The Sims 4 base game update on January 13, featuring nine items and 65 prints, amid strong brand sales growth among Gen Z.

items.title: IGT Executive Andy Hendrickson Promoted to Chief Product & Technology Officer
items.summary: IGT announced Andy Hendrickson, former CTO, will expand his role to Chief Product & Technology Officer, bringing expertise from Activision and innovation in gaming tech.

items.title: Global Game Jam Returns to Green Bay Bigger Than Ever
items.summary: The University of Wisconsin-Green Bay will host a larger Global Game Jam site from January 30 to February 1, 2026, expecting over 50 participants to create games in 48 hours.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
